title: How many World Wars until now have taken place? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends on how does one define as ‘world war’. As mentioned by most answers, there are only two wars being called ‘world war’. The first one is World War I from 1914 to 1918 between the alliance of France, Britain, Russia, USA and the alliance of Germany, Austrohungarian empire and Ottoman Empire, with the british side emerged as victorious. World War II, from 1939 to 1945, between Allies (USA, UK, France, USSR, China) and axis power (Italy, Germany, Japan). The allies were victorious. However in my opinion, there are some wars in the past which did not get named explicitly as ‘world war’ but was indeed a world war. Examples include Punic war, between Carthage and rome, which the first one involved the western mediterranean while the second one involved not just the Mediterranean but also spain, italy and north africa, a war with a scale, duration and casaulty unseen by then. Another example would be the thirty year war and the seven year war. The thirty year war involved most Europe, which by then was pretty much the ‘whole world’. It involved countries like Sweden, france, holy roman empire, spain, england, all were great powers by then. The damage was also very extensive, especially to Germany, demonstrating the scale of the war. The seven year war was another massive scale war, involving multiple continents and ranged from naval battle to land battle, between france, austria, russia, prussia and britain, which were the strongest nations at that time. A further example would be Napolean war, which like Seven year war involved almost all european power houses and was also fought in multiple continents with both naval and land battles. Honorable mentions include Persian invasion of Greece, war of the Alexander the great, etc.

There were two World Wars. The First WW was 1914–1918. The USA entered the war in 1917. President Wilson could keep us out no longer. The Second WW was from 1939–1945. Hitler invaded Poland on September 1, 1939, (thus began the Second confligration of Europe).The US entered this war on December 8, 1941. The Japanese Empire attacked (without warning), a literal sleeping Naval base, in Pearl Harbor, Hawaii at about 7:45–8a Sunday morning, December 7, 1941. ‘A Day Which Will Live in Infamy…’ President FDR thundered to Congress. 3,000 men and women were slain. The women were nurses.
